page.title: 02AN INTRODUCTION TO HEMINGBY.
page.content: Hemingby has about 300 residents. During the last fifteen years a lot of new buildings, mainly bungalows have been erected.The village will not be allowed to extend its boundaries further; new houses may only be erected in existing gaps.Most of the houses are red brick.About fifty of the inhabitants are involved in agricultural work.The village has had a church since at least the fifteenth century.The present church was erected in 1896. It is made of stone. The methodist church is now derelict. The village has a public house,(one of the oldest buildings in the village) called the 'Coach and Horses'.There is a post office and village store with plant nursery.The village school, which closed in 1970 has been converted into a well used village hall. {
